abstract.p: Swiss National Bank begins to sell part of country's gold reserves under plan to dispose of some $10 billion of bullion in next five years (S)

block.p: The Swiss central bank has begun to sell part of the country's gold reserves under a plan to dispose of some $10 billion of bullion in the next several years. The bank, which has the third-largest gold reserves, commissioned the Basel-based Bank for International Settlements to sell the first installment of an estimated 1,300 tons of gold slated for sale in the next five years. The first portion of 120 metric tons is equal to 3 percent of last year's world demand. The Swiss National Bank will divest itself of the gold gradually to to try to avoid depressing prices.
